metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Hitachi is looking for a Senior Manager of IT Business Enablement who has both a strong functional skill set with the ability to design complex system solutions. This individual will deliver finance & supply chain system solutions while providing designs that support day to day finance & supply chain operations at Hitachi Vantara.  This individual must have a passion for technology delivery and be able to thrive in a dynamic, fast changing environment, without losing sight of core processes around development and delivery.  Must be able to work on and balance multiple high priority items at the same time.

The manager of business enablement must have a strong understanding of Oracle eBusiness Suite within the Finance & Supply Chain modules.  This individual must be able to work independently with little supervision and still retains hands on knowledge to jump in as required. Manages and validates the creation of key documentation for business requirements, functional specifications, technical specifications and testing documents will be required. Must be able to work directly with the finance & supply chain business team to define and refine requirements and propose solutions. 

Key Responsibilities:

•	Manage functional business analyst/architect team for finance and supply chain applications within Oracle EBS, SaaS & custom applications.
•	Hands on position with the ability to configure/design solutions if needed. Coach & Mentor team and other members within the organization on best practices.
•	Collaborate with delivery, data, support, and development leaders and members to get work completed.
•	Ability to work within a matrixed environment to complete projects and enhancements.
•	Work with cross-functional teams across IT to ensure that all processes, procedures and policies are adhered to for the projects and enhancements.
•	Guide the design, development, testing and deployment of new business functionality.
•	Define scope and deliverables with dates and milestones for projects as required.
•	Drive the process efforts by participating in workshops, designing and communicating technical solutions.
•	Provide guidance on how technology solutions could solve business problems and enable new business functionality.
•	Willingness to work outside of standard business hours to resolve issues or complete special projects if required.


QUALIFICATIONS:
•	Strong experience and understanding of business processes in Finance and Supply Chain
•	Good knowledge of Application Architecture methodologies.
•	Must be a self-starter with the desire to expand knowledge in other areas.
•	Must have experience designing complex system solutions within finance and supply chain.
•	Requires ability to influence others to accept practices and approaches, and ability to communicate and influence executive leadership.
•	Experience working with and integrating with third-party applications.
•	Excellent interpersonal, communication written and verbal and leadership skills.
•	At least 10 years of Oracle EBS platform functional experience.
•	At least 10 years of Oracle Financial experience in at least 3 or more modules: AR, AP, GL, FA, PA, SLA, CM.
•	Minimum 5 years managing a team of business analysts within an IT organization.
•	At least 5 years of Oracle Supply Chain experience in at least 2 or more modules/areas: INV, OM, WIP, BOM, Pricing, Shipping, Logistics, JIT, ATP and advanced supply chain planning.
•	Completed at least 2 full-lifecycle implementations of Oracle EBS or another ERP system.
 
Education and Experience:

•	Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology Management or related discipline.
•	Must have formal process documentation experience using software tools to capture business process flows. 
•	PMP and/or Agile Practitioner training or certification is highly desired.
•	Advanced knowledge and has played a key role in designing functional standards and processes for an organization and/or following a comprehensive standard.
•	Subscription billing, RevPro or similar Revenue Recognition and treasury experience is highly preferred.
•	Knowledge of all phases of software development including requirements/story gathering, analysis, solution design, development, testing (unit, integration, end-to-end user), implementation, and support.

title: Senior Manager, Corporate Applications (Oracle EBS)
content:
We’re Hitachi Vantara, a global infrastructure business. Our people are the force of meaningful progress. We enable the incredible with data – from taking theme park fans on magical rides, conserving natural resources, protecting rainforests to saving lives. We empower businesses to automate, optimize and advance innovation. Together, we create a sustainable future for all. 
Imagine the sheer breadth of talent it takes to inspire he future. We don’t expect you to ‘fit’ every requirement – your life experience, character, perspective, and passion for achieving great things in the world are equally important to us.The role 
Hitachi Vantara is looking for a Senior Manager of Corporate Applications who has both a strong functional skill set with the ability to design complex system solutions. This individual will deliver finance & supply chain system solutions while providing designs that support day to day finance & supply chain operations at Hitachi Vantara. This individual must have a passion for technology delivery and be able to thrive in a dynamic, fast-changing environment, without losing sight of core processes around development and delivery. Must be able to work on and balance multiple high priority items at the same time.
The Senior Manager of Corporate Applications must have a strong understanding of Oracle eBusiness Suite within the Finance & Supply Chain modules. This individual must be able to work independently with little supervision and still retain hands-on knowledge to jump in as required. Manages and validates the creation of key documentation for business requirements, functional specifications, technical specifications, and testing documents will be required. Must be able to work directly with the finance & supply chain business team to define and refine requirements and propose solutions.
This is NOT a consulting or project delivery role.  We are seeking a Manager or Senior Manager who can be functional technical with configuration knowledge in the system and is very hands-on.  
What you’ll be doing 

Manage functional business analyst/architect team for finance and supply chain applications within Oracle EBS, SaaS & custom applications.
Hands on position with the ability to configure/design solutions if needed. Coach & Mentor team and other members within the organization on best practices.
Collaborate with delivery, data, support, and development leaders and members to get work completed.
Ability to work within a matrixed environment to complete projects and enhancements.
Work with cross-functional teams across IT to ensure that all processes, procedures, and policies are adhered to for the projects and enhancements.
Guide the design, development, testing and deployment of new business functionality.
Define scope and deliverables with dates and milestones for projects as required.
Drive the process efforts by participating in workshops, designing, and communicating technical solutions.
Provide guidance on how technology solutions could solve business problems and enable new business functionality.
Willingness to work outside of standard business hours to resolve issues or complete special projects if required.

 What you’ll bring


Qualifications:

8+ years of Oracle EBS platform functional experience.
8+ years of Oracle Financial experience in at least 3 or more modules: AR, AP, GL, FA, PA, SLA, CM.
5+ years of Oracle Supply Chain experience in at least 2 or more modules: INV, OM, WIP, BOM, or Pricing.
3+ years of people management experience (hiring, firing, performance reviews) within an IT team.  
Completed at least 2 full-lifecycle implementations of Oracle EBS or another ERP system.
Good knowledge of Application Architecture methodologies.
Requires ability to influence others to accept practices and approaches, and ability to communicate and influence executive leadership.
Experience working with and integrating with third-party applications.



Education Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology Management or related discipline.
Must have formal process documentation experience using software tools to capture business process flows.
PMP and/or Agile Practitioner training or certification is highly desired.
Advanced knowledge and has played a key role in designing functional standards and processes for an organization and/or following a comprehensive standard.
Subscription billing, RevPro or similar Revenue Recognition and treasury experience is highly preferred.
Knowledge of all phases of software development including requirements/story gathering, analysis, solution design, development, testing (unit, integration, end-to-end user), implementation, and support.



 
As required by the equal pay and transparency acts, the expected base salary for this position is:

Tier One Location (including New York City and California Bay Area): $146k -$180k.
Tier Two Location (including Colorado, Seattle, and the rest of California): $130k - $170k.
Tier Three Location (including the rest of Washington State): $120k – $150k.

The expected pay is determined based on a variety of factors including, but not limited to, depth of experience in the practice area. Employees are eligible to participate in Hitachi Vantara’s bonus/variable/commission pay programs, where applicable, and are subject to the program’s conditions and restrictions.
#LI-MH1Championing diversity, equity, and inclusion 
Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our culture and identity. Diverse thinking, a commitment to allyship, and a culture of empowerment help us achieve powerful results. We want you to be you, with all the ideas, lived experience, and fresh perspective that brings. We support your uniqueness and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our team.
How we look after you
We want to help you take care of your today and tomorrow – at home and at work. Which is why we offer industry-leading benefits that go far beyond compensation. That means support, services, and resources that also take care of your holistic health and wellbeing. We’re always looking for new ways of working that bring out our best, which leads to unexpected ideas. Here, you’ll experience a sense of belonging, and discover autonomy, freedom, and ownership as you work alongside talented people you enjoy sharing knowledge with. We’re also champions of life balance and offer flexible arrangements that work for you (role and location dependent).
About us
We’re a global team of innovators. Together, we harness engineering excellence and passion for insight to co-create meaningful solutions to complex challenges. We turn organizations into data-driven leaders that can a make positive impact on their industries and society. If you believe that innovation can inspire the future, this is the place to fulfil your purpose and achieve your potential.
We’re proud to say we’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, age, disability status or any other protected characteristic. Should you need reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know so that we can do our best to set you up for success.

We are an equal opportunity employer and seek to strengthen our hiring practices by identifying and mitigating the potential for bias in our assessment and selection processes.
